recipe.ingredients: - fresh strawberries: 2 cups - full-fat coconut milk: 1 can (13.5 ounces) - natural sweetener (such as stevia or erythritol): 1/3 cup - vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon - lemon juice: 1 tablespoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prep Strawberries: Hull the strawberries and puree them until smooth using a blender or food processor. 2. Mix Ingredients: In a large bowl, whisk together the strawberry puree, coconut milk, natural sweetener, vanilla extract, and lemon juice until well combined. 3. Churn: Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturerâ€™s instructions. 4. Freeze: Transfer the churned ice cream to a freezer-safe container and freeze until firm, about 4-6 hours. 5. Serve: Let the ice cream thaw for a few minutes before serving for easier scooping.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 18g, Dietary Fiber: 2g, Sodium: 45mg, Saturated Fat: 13g, Total Fat: 18g, Protein: 2g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 7g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe: Approximately 920 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Fresh Strawberries: 144 calories for 2 cups Coconut Milk: 735 calories per can Natural Sweetener: 0 calories (assuming zero-calorie sweetener) Vanilla Extract: 12 calories per teaspoon Lemon Juice: 4 calories per tablespoon - Serving People: 6
